lines.text: Yes, Marlin. No, I see it. It’s beautiful!

So, Coral, when you said you wanted an ocean view, you didn’t think that we were gonna get the whole ocean, did you? Huh? Oh, yeah. A fish can breath out here. Did your man deliver, or did he deliver?
Because a lot of other clownfish had their eyes on this place.
You better believe they did. Every single one of them.
Mm-hmm. You did good. And the neighborhood is awesome!
So, you do like it, don’t you?

No, no, no no. I do, I do, I do! I really do like it. But Marlin, I know that the drop off is desirable, with the great schools and the amazing view, and all that, but do we really need so much space?
Coral, honey, these are our kids we’re talking about. They deserve the best. Look, look, look. They’ll wake up, poke their little heads out, and they see a whale! See, right by their bedroom window.
Shh! You’re gonna wake the kids.
Aw, look! They’re dreaming. We still have to name them.
You wanna name all of them, right now? All right, we’ll name this half Marlin Jr. and then this half Coral Junior. Okay, we’re done!
Nemo? Well, we’ll name one Nemo, but I’d like most of them to be Marlin Junior.
Just think that in a couple of days, we’re going to be parents!
Yeah. What if they don’t like me?
Odds are, one of them is bound to like you.
Well, I remember. "Excuse me, miss, can you check and see if there’s a hook in my lip?"
Well, you gotta look a little closer because it’s wiggling.
Coral, get inside the house, Coral.
No, Coral, don’t. They’ll be fine. Just get inside. You, right now.
There, there, there. It’s okay, Daddy’s here. Daddy’s got you. I promise, I will never let anything happen to you, Nemo.
First day of school! First day of school! Wake up, wake up! Come on, first day of school!
I don’t want to go to school. Five more minutes.
Get up, get up! It’s time for school! It’s time for school! It’s time for school! It’s time for school!
All right, I’m up. It's time for school. Oh, boy! Oh, boy! Oh boy- whoa!
(marlin finds nemo) (muffled) First day of school!
[gasps] Nemo, don't move! Don't move! You'll never get out of there yourself. I'll do it. All right, where's the break? You feel a break?
Sometimes you can’t tell ‘cause fluid is rushing to the area. Now, any rushing fluids?
Are you woozy? How many stripes do I have?
No! See, something’s wrong with you. I have one, two, three. That’s all I have? Oh. You're okay. How’s the lucky fin?
Let’s see. Are you sure you wanna go to school this year? 'Cause there's no problem if you don't. You can wait five or six years.
Come on, Dad! It’s time for school.
Do you want this anemone to sting you?
There! [laughing] Right there. And here and here and here!
All right, we’re excited. First day of school, here we go. We’re ready to learn to get some knowledge. Now, what’s the one thing we have to remember about the ocean?

That’s my boy. So, first we check to see that the coast is clear. We go out and back in. And then we go out, and back in. And then we go out, and back in. And then one more time. Out and back in. And sometimes, if you want a do it four times...
Dad, maybe while I’m at school, I’ll see a shark!
Have you ever met a shark?
No, and I don’t plan to.
Sandy Plankton from next door, he said that sea turtles, [stammers] said that they live to be about a hundred years old!

Well, you know what, if I ever meet a sea turtle, I'll ask him. After I'm done talking to the shark, okay? Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hold on, hold on, wait to cross. [The traffic stopped because of that one red fish.] Hold my fin, hold my fin.
Dad, you’re not gonna freak out like you did at the petting zoo, are you?
Hey, that snail was about to charge. Hmm, I wonder where we're supposed to go.
I’ll pick you up after school.
Come on, you guys. Stop it! Give it back!
Come on, we’ll try over there.
Excuse me, is this where we meet his teacher?
Well, look who’s out of the anemone.
Bill. Hey, you’re a clownfish! You’re funny, right? Hey, tell us a joke!
Well, actually, that’s a common misconception. Clownfish are no funnier than any other fish.

All right, I know one joke. There’s a mollusk, see? And he walks up to a sea... Well, he doesn’t walk up, he swims up. Well, actually, the mollusk isn’t moving. He’s in one place and then the sea cucumber, well they I mixed up. There was a mollusk and a sea cucumber. None of them were walking, so forget that I..
Sheldon! Get out of Mr. Johannsen’s yard, now!!
All right, you kids! Where’d you go?
Dad, can I go play too? Can I?
I would feel better if you go play over on the sponge beds. That’s where I would play.
Ow! Hey, what’d I do? What’d I do?
Be nice! It’s his first time at school!
He was born with it, kids. We call it his lucky fin.
See this tentacle? It’s actually shorter than all my other tentacles. But you can’t really tell. Especially when I twirl them like this.
Mesopolagic, bathyal, abyssalpelagic. All the rest are too deep for you and me to see. Huh? I wonder where my class has gone.
Oh, there you are. Climb aboard, explorers! Oh, Knowledge exploring is oh so lyrical, when you think thoughts that are empirical.
Well, Nemo, all new explorers must answer a science question.
You live in what kind of home?
Okay, okay, don’t hurt yourself. Welcome aboard, explorers!
Just so you know, he’s got a little fin. I find if he’s having trouble swimming, let him take a break, 10, 15 minutes.
Dad, it’s time for you to go now.
Don’t worry. We’re gonna stay together as a group. Okay, class, optical orbits up front! And remember, we keep our supraesophogeal ganglion to ourselves, that means you, Jimmy.
Hey, you’re doing pretty well for a first timer.
Well, you can’t hold onto them forever, can you?
I had a tough time when my oldest went out at the drop off.
They just gotta grow up some-- THE DROP OFF?! They’re going to the drop off?! What, what, why would you, what are you, insane?! Why don’t we just fry them up now and serve them with chips?!
Don’t tell me to be calm, pony boy!
You know, for a clownfish, he really isn't that funny.

Okay, the drop off. All right, kids, feel free to explore but stay close. [he spots a yellow glowing light and gasps] Stromalitic cyanobacteria! Gather! An entire ecosystem contained in one infinitesimal speck. There are as many protein pairs contained in this…
...the entire ocean. Come on, sing with me!
[shrieks] Aww, you guys made me ink!
I know what that is. Oh, oh. Sandy Plankton saw one. He called, he said it was called, uhh, a butt!
Wow! That’s a pretty big butt.
Aww, you guys made me ink!
I know what that is. Oh, oh. Sandy Plankton saw one. He called, he said it was called, uhh, a butt!
Wow! That’s a pretty big butt.
Oh, look at me. I’m gonna go touch the butt! [sneezes] Whoa!!
Oh, yeah? Let’s see you get closer.
Come on, Nemo. How far can you go?
Oh, um... my dad says it’s not safe.
You were about to swim into open water!
No, I wasn’t gonna go out there!
It was a good thing I was here.
If I hadn’t showed up, I don’t know...
This does not concern you, kids. And you’re lucky I don’t tell your parents you were out there. You know you can’t swim well!
I can swim fine, Dad, okay?
You shouldn’t be anywhere near here! Okay, I was right. You know what? You’ll start school in a year or two.
No, Dad! Just because you’re scared of the ocean...
Clearly, you’re not ready. And you’re not coming back until you are. You think you can do these things but you just can’t, Nemo!
nothing to see. Gather, over there. Excuse me, is there anything I can do? I am a scientist, sir. Is there any problem?
I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to interrupt things. He isn’t a good swimmer. I just think it’s a little too soon for him to be out here unsupervised.
Well, I can assure you, he’s quite safe with me.
Look, I’m sure he is. But you have a large class and he can get lost from sight if you’re not looking. I’m not saying you’re not looking...
Oh, my gosh! Nemo’s swimming out to sea!
Nemo!!! What do you think you’re doing?!
You’re gonna get stuck out there, and I’m gonna have to get you before another fish does! Get back here!
I said get back here, now!!
You take one more move, mister...!
D-Don’t you dare, if you put one fin on that boat! Are you listening to me?! Don’t touch the b...
You just paddle your little tail right back here, Nemo! That’s right! You are in big trouble, young man! Do you hear me? Big...!
Nemo, No! Nemo! Nemo! Nemo! No!
Oh, no. No. No, It’s gone. It’s gone. No, no, it can’t be gone! No, no!!
Nemo! Nemo! No! No, please, no!!!
Has anybody seen a boat?! Please!!! A white boat!!! They took my son!!! My son!!! Help me, please!!!
Oh, oh! Sorry! I didn’t see you. Sir, are you okay?
No, no! They took him away! I have to find the boat!
A boat? Hey, I’ve seen a boat!
Uh-huh. And it passed by not too long ago.
Oh! Oh, oh, oh! It went, umm... This way! It went this way! Follow me!
Thank you! Thank you! Thank you, so much!
I’m trying to swim here! What, ocean ain’t big enough for you or something like that? You got a problem, buddy? Huh? HUH? Do you? Do you? You want a piece of me? Yeah, I’m scared now. What!
What're you talking about? You’re showing me which way the boat went!
A boat? Hey, I’ve seen a boat. It passed by not too long ago. It went ummm... This way! It went this way. Follow me!
Wait a minute, wait a minute!! What is going on?! You already told me which way the boat was going!
If this is some kind of practical joke, it’s not funny! And I know funny... I’m a clownfish!
No, it’s not. I know it’s not. I’m so sorry. See, I suffer from short-term memory loss.
Short-term memory loss. I don’t believe this!
No, it’s true. I forget things almost instantly. It runs in my family. Well, I mean, at least I think it does. Hmmm... Where are they? Can I help you?
Something’s wrong with you, really. You’re wasting my time. I have to find my son.
It’s all right, I understand. Why trust a shark, right?
So, what’s a couple of bites like you doing out so late, eh?
Nothing. We’re not doing anything. We’re not even out.
Great! Then how’d you morsels like to come to a little... A little get-together I’m having?
Yeah, yeah, right. A party! What do you say?
Oh, I love parties! That like sounds fun!
You know, parties are fun, and it’s tempting but can't because...
Oh, okay! That’s all that matters.
Hey, look. Balloons! It is a party!
Mind your distance, though. Those balloons can be a bit dodgy. You wouldn’t want one of them to pop.
We’ve already gone through all the snacks and I’m still starving!
We almost had to have a feeding frenzy.
Come on, let’s get this over with!
Right, then. The meeting has officially come to order. Let us all say the pledge.
I am a nice shark, not a mindless eating machine. If I am to change this image, I must first change myself. Fish are friends, not food.
Dolphins, Yeah! They think they’re so cute. "Oh, look at me. I’m a flipping little dolphin! Let me flip for you. Ain’t I something?"
Right, then. Today’s meeting is step five: Bring a Fish Friend. Now, do you all have your friends?
Oh. Well, I, umm, seem to have misplaced my, umm, friend.
I had a feeling this would be a difficult step, you can help yourself to one of my friends.
Oh, thanks, mate. A little chum for Chum, eh?
I’ll start the testimonies. Hello, my name is Bruce.
It has been three weeks since my last fish, on my honor, or may I be chopped up and made into soup.
You’re an inspiration to all of us!
Yes, the little Sheila down the front!
And... Well, I don’t think I’ve ever eaten a fish.
I’m glad I got that off my chest.
All right, anyone else? Hello, how ‘bout you, mate? What’s your problem?
Me? I don’t have a problem.
Okay. Uh, hello. My name is Marlin. I’m a clownfish.
Go on! Tell us a joke!

Well, I actually I do know one that’s [chuckles] pretty good. Umm... There was this mollusk, and he walks up to a, a sea cucumber. Normally, they don’t talk, sea cucumbers, but in a joke, everyone talks. So, the sea mollusk says to the cucumber...
Nemo! [laughs] Nemo! [realizes] I don’t get it.
For a clownfish, he’s not that funny.
No, no, no, no, he’s my son. He was taken by, by these divers.
Now, there is a father looking for his little boy!
Ugh! What do these markings mean?
Well then, we gotta find a fish who can read this. Hey, look, sharks!
Hey, that’s mine! Give it to me!
I’m sorry. Are you okay? I'm so sorry.
You really clocked me there. Am I bleeding? Ow, ow, ow...
Remember, Bruce, fish are friends, not food!
There’s no way out! There’s got to be a way to escape!
Dory, help me find a way out!
Sorry, you’ll have to come back later. We’re trying to escape.
Okay, there's no way out. There’s gotta be a way out!
Look, here’s something! "Es-cap-e." I wonder what that means. It’s funny, it’s spelled just like the word "escape"-
Wait a minute. You can read?
I can read? That’s right! I can read!
Well, then here! Read this now!
He really doesn’t mean it, you know! He never even knew his father!!
I need to get that mask!
No, no, no, no, no, no!!!
Quick, grab the mask! Grab it!!
I need to get that mask!
No, no, no, no, no, no!!!
Quick, grab the mask! Grab it!!
Barbara? Prep for his anterior crown, would you, please? And I’m going to need a few cotton rolls.
[chuckling] Beauty, isn’t he? I found that guy struggling for life out on the reef and I saved him. So, has that Novocaine kicked in yet?
Slow down, little fella. There’s nothing to worry about.
I want to go home! Do you know where my dad is?
Honey, your dad’s probably back at the pet store.
Yeah. Like I’m from Bob’s Fish Mart.
Ah, the ocean- THE OCEAN!!! AAAAAHHHHH!!!!
He hasn’t been decontaminated yet! Jacques! Clean him!
Ooh, La mer. Bon. (Ooh, the sea. Good.)
Wow. The big blue. What’s it like?

Kid, if there’s anything you need, just ask your auntie Deb, that’s me! Or if I’m not around, you can always talk to my sister Flo [Her reflection]. Hi, how are ya? Don’t listen to anything my sister says, she’s nuts!
I said we got a live one.
Root canal. And by the looks of those X-rays, it's not gonna be pretty.
What did he use to open?
Gator-Glidden drill. He seems to be favoring that one lately.
[mumbling, then a picker over his teeth, screaming]
Now, he’s doing the Schilder technique.
That’s not a Hedstrom file. That’s a K-Flex.
It’s got a teardrop cross-section. Clearly a Hedstrom.
All right, go ahead and rinse.
Ugh! The human mouth is a disgusting place.
What did I miss? Am I late?
Root canal, and it’s a doozy.
Root canal. What did he use to open?
He seems to be favoring that one. Hope he doesn’t get surplus sealer at the portal terminus. Hello! Who’s this?
The dentist took him off the reef.
An outie. From my neck of the woods? Sorry if I ever took a snap at you. Fish gotta swim, birds gotta eat.
Hey! No, no, no, no! Those aren't your fish! They’re my fish! Come on! Go! Go on! Shoo! Shoo!

The picture broke. This here’s Darla. She’s my niece. She’s gonna be eight next week. Hey, little fella. Say hello to your new mummy. She’ll be here Friday to pick you up. You’re her present. Shh! It’s our little secret. Well, Mr. Tucker, while that sets up I’m going to see a man about a wallaby. I’ll be right back.
She wouldn’t stop shaking the bag.
He was her present last year.
Hitched a ride on the porcelain express.
[scared] I can’t go with that girl! I have to get back to my dad! [gets sucked into a tube] Aah!!! Daddy!!! Help me!!!
No. You got yourself in there, you can get yourself out.
I just wanna see him do it, okay? Calm down. Alternate wiggling your fins and your tail.
I can’t. I have a bad fin!
Never stopped me. [Nemo looked and notice a scar on the side of Gill's body] Just think about what you need to do.
Wow. From the ocean. Just like you, Gill.
[chuckles] I’ve seen that look before. What are you thinking about?
I’m thinking, tonight, we give the kid a proper reception.
OK, kid you got a name or what?
Are you gonna eat that? [snoring] ...Careful with that hammer.
No, no! What does it say?
Wake up!! Get up! Come on! Come on!!
NO!!! Not the mask!! Get it! Get the mask! Get it!! [panting]
[humming] Whoo-hoo! Just keeps going on, doesn’t it? Echo! Echo! What are you doing?
It’s gone! I’ve lost the mask.
You dropped it!! That was my only chance of finding my son, now it’s gone!
Hey, Mr. Grumpy Gills. When life gets you down, you know what you gotta do?
I don’t want to know what you gotta do.
[singing] Just keep swimming, just keep swimming, just keep swimming, swimming, swimming. What do we do? We swim swim.
I love to swim! When you want to swim...
See, I’m going to get stuck now with that song now it’s in my head!
Who could it be? It’s me!
Yeah. I’m your conscience. We haven’t spoken for a while. How are you?
Good. Now, Dory. I want you to tell me..do you see anything?
I see... I see a light.
Yeah. Over there. Hey, conscience. Am I dead?
No, I see it too. What is it?
Hi, I’m feeling happy. Which is a big deal for me.
I want to touch it. Oh!
Hey, come back. Come on back here!
[singing] I’m gonna get you. I’m gonna get you. I’m gonna swim with you.
I’m gonna get you. I’m gonna be your best friend... good feeling’s gone.
I can’t see!!! I don’t know where I’m going!!! The mask!!!
What mask? OK, I can’t see a thing.
I’m sorry, but if you could just bring it a little closer, I kind of need the light. That’s great, keep it right there.
OK, OK. Mr. Bossy. P’. OK, ‘P. Sher…P. Shirley? P not Shirley. The first line’s ‘P. Sherman’!
P. Sherman doesn’t make any sense!!!
That’s great! Speed read!!! Take a guess! No pressure!!!! No problem! There’s a lot of pressure! Pressure!!!! Take a guess now with pressure!!
Duck! [pants] I’m dead, I’m dead, I’m dead, I’m dead, I’m dead, I died, I’m dead. [gasps]
[laughs] Whoo-hoo! [singing] We did it! Oh, yeah! No eating here tonight, whoo!
No, eating here tonight. You on a diet.
Dory! What did it say? What did the mask say?
"P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney". [gasps] I remember what it said! I usually forget things, but I remembered it this time! P Sherman-
I don’t know. But who cares? I remembered!
P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. I remembered it again!!
Nemo! Newcomer of orange and white, you have been called forth to the summit of Mount Wannahockaloogie to join with us in the fraternal bonds of tank-hood.
We want you in our club, kid.
If you are able to swim through...
Turn on the Ring of Fire. The Ring of Fire, you said you could do it...
Isn’t there another way?! He’s just a boy!!
From this moment on, you will now be known as Sharkbait.
OK, Sharkbait’s one of us now, agreed?
We can’t send him off to his death. Darla’s coming in five days, so what are we gonna do? I’ll tell you what we’re gonna do: we’re gonna get him outta here. We’re gonna help him escape,
Gill, please, not another one of your escape plans.
Sorry, but they, they just, they never work.
Yeah. Why should this be any different?

You’re the only one who can get in and out of that thing. What we need you to do is take a pebble inside and jam the gears. You do that and this tank’s gonna get filthier and filthier by the minute. Pretty soon, the dentist’ll have to clean the tank himself. And when he does, he’ll take us out of the tank, put us in the individual baggies, then we roll ourselves down the counter, out of the window, off the awning, into the bushes, across the street and into the harbor! It’s foolproof! Who’s with me?
No offense kid, but, you’re not the best swimmer.
He’s fine, he can do this! So Sharkbait, what do you think?

I’m going to P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Where are you going? I’m going to P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. If you’re asking where I’m going. I’ll tell you that’s where I’m going. It’s P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Where? I’m sorry, I didn’t hear you. P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way…

Excuse me... Hi. Do you know how to get to hello? Wait! Can you tell me... Hey! Hold it! Wait a minute! I’m trying to talk to you! OK, fellas, come back here. Please, one quick question. I need to and they’re gone again. [sighing]
P. Sherman 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Why do I have to tell you over and over again? I’ll tell you again. I don’t get tired of it...
OK, all right. Here’s the thing. You know, I just, think it’s best if I just, if I just, carry on from here by myself.
You know, alone. Without, well, I mean, not without you. I mean, it’s just that I don’t want you, with me.
I don’t want a hurt your feelings..

Well, I mean not. Yes. Yeah. It’s just that you know I just can’t afford anymore delays and you’re one of those fish that cause delays. And sometimes it’s a good thing. There’s a whole group of fish. They’re delay fish.
You mean... [whimpers] You mean you don’t like me?
No, of course I like you. It’s because I like you I don’t want a be with you. It’s a complicated emotion.
I’m totally excited! [yawns] Are you excited?
That’s not a duck, It’s a PELICAN!!!
NO!! I DIDN'T COME THIS FAR TO BE BREAKFAST!!!
Hey, Nigel. Would you look at that?
Sun’s barely up and already Gerald’s had more than he can handle.
Yeah. Reckon somebody oughta help the poor guy.
Well, don’t everybody fly off at once.
All right, Gerald, what is it? Fish got your tongue? Love a duck!!!
I gotta find my son, Nemo!!!
"Nemo?"! Hey, it’s that fish! Y’know the one we were talking about! The one that’s been fighting the whole ocean! Hey, I know where your son...
I got something to tell you!
OK. Don’t make any sudden moves. Hop inside my mouth if you want to live.
Hop in your mouth? And how does that make me live?
Because I can take you to your son.
No. I know your son. He’s orange, he’s got a gimpy fin on one side..
*taps the fish tank's exterior by using a bare finger* [singing] Twinkle, twinkle little star!!
*unsticks from the fish tank's interior* Find a happy place, find a happy place, find a happy place!!!!
Darla, your uncle will see you now.
All right, let’s see those pearly whites.
[roars] I’m a piranha. They’re in the Amazon.
And a piranha’s a fish, just like your present!
Must’ve left your present in the car, sweetie. I’ll go and get it.
What’s happening? Why is he playing dead?
[overjoyed] He’s gonna get flushed down the toilet!! He’s gonna get outta here!!
[horrified] Oh, no, not the trash can!!!
[arrives at the window with Marlin and Dory in his mouth] Hey. I found his dad!!
What’s a dentist?! What is that?! Nigel, get in there!!
Oh, yes you can! [He grab Nigel's tongue] Charge!!!!
What the…?! Darla, sweetie, look out! Steady! Hold still! Easy! Hold still! It's all right! Nobody’s going to hurt you!
Out with ya! And stay out!!
*grabs the liquid bag that has the clownfish called Nemo inside the liquid bag* Fishy? *shakes the liquid bag* Fishy! Wake up! Wake up!!
Quick! To the top of Mt. Wannahockaloogie!!!
Crikey?! All the animals have gone mad! [grunts]
Fish in my hair!! *Gill falls off Darla's head then lands onto the wet dentist thing where Nemo is*
Sharkbait. Tell your Dad, I said hi.
Is he gonna be OK, Gill?
Don’t worry. All drains lead to the ocean.
Dory. If it wasn’t for you, I never even would have made it here. So, thank you.
Hey, wait a minute. Wait! Where are you going?
It’s over, Dory. We were too late. Nemo’s gone and I’m going home now.

No. No, you can’t! Stop! Please don’t go away. Please? No one’s ever stuck with me for so long before. And if you leave, if you leave…I just, I remember things better with you. I do. Look, P. Sherman, 42..! Ugh! I remember it, I do. It’s there, I know it is because when I look at you, I can feel it. And, I look at you and… I’m home. Please. I don’t want them to go away. I don’t want to forget.
I’m sorry, Dory, but I do.
Yeah, that’s it fella! Just keep on swimming, you got that.
Too right, mate! I got a live one here!!
Excuse me. Are you all right?
No! I don’t know where I am! I don’t know what’s going on, I think I lost somebody but I can’t remember.
It’s OK. I’m looking for someone too. We can look together.
Dad!! Wait a minute, is it your dad or my dad?
Dad!! Dad!! Oh. Syl-shi Sydney." [Gasps] [Voice Echoing] P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney." [Yells] NEMO!!! IT’S YOU!!! YOU’RE NEMO!!!
Oh! You’re Nemo!! You were dead! I saw you! And then I, here you are! I found you! You’re not dead! And your father- (GASP) Your FATHER!
My father?! You know my father?! Where is he?!
This way! He went this way! Quick!!
Hey! Have you seen an orange fish swim by? It looks just like him!
Yeah, I saw I'm, Bluey. But I’m not telling you where he went. And there’s no way you’re gonna make me!
[yells] ALL RIGHT!!! I’LL TALK, I'LL TALK!!! HE WENT TO THE FISHING GROUNDS!!!
Sorry. Just trying to get home.
Thank goodness!! It’s all right, son! It’s gonna be OK.
Turn around! You’re going the wrong way!!
Dad! I know what to do!!
We have to tell all the fish to swim down together!
No, I am not gonna lose you again!!
Dad, there’s no time!! It’s the only way we can save Dory! I can do this!
You’re right. I know you can.
Tell all of the fish to swim down!!
Well?! You heard my son! Come on!
Dory! We have to tell everybody to...
...swim down together! Do you understand what I’m saying to you?! Swim down!!
Come on! You have to swim down!
Down!! Swim down!! Swim down!! Swim down!!
Don’t give up! Keep swimming! Just keep swimming! That's it!
Let’s get to the bottom! Keep swimming!
[singing] Just keep swimming, just keep swimming...
